snippet: The government announced plans this week to absorb the fund, 1Malaysia Development Berhad, prompting worries that it would also assume the fund’s debt.
abstract: Malaysian government has said it will close and absorb 1Malaysia Development Berhad, state fund tied to corruption inquiry into Prime Min Najib Razak; critics and opposition charge action will oblige government to absorb fund's $6.75 billion in debt, leading to bailout.
lead_paragraph: The government announced plans this week to absorb the fund, 1Malaysia Development Berhad, prompting worries that it would also assume the fund’s debt.

headline.main: Closing of Malaysian Fund Could Shift Billions in Debt to Government, Critics Fear
headline.print_headline: Closing of Troubled State Fund Raises Fears of a Bailout in Malaysia
